definition: to walk (side part of split character)

the right of immunity from arrest afforded by the Taiwan ROC Constitution, for the duration of meetings, unless caught actually committing a crime, to members of the National Assembly, the Legislative Yuan, or a supervisory committee
beyond one's reach or power (to do sth)
lit. a dog who catches mice (idiom)/fig. to be meddlesome

sentences.english: The captured robber grinned at the policeman.
sentences.chinese: 被逮的強盜對警察露齒獰笑。

sentences.english: Jo wrathfully proposed that Mr. Davis be arrested without delay.
sentences.chinese: 裘怒衝衝地提議，應當把戴維先生毫不遲延地逮起來。

sentences.english: We had a famous set-to at rat-hunting all the morning in my father's great barns;
sentences.chinese: 我們在我父親的大谷倉裏逮老鼠，大鬧了一個上午。

sentences.english: To err is human:to forgive, divine.
Amy's brother was caught red-handed at the scene of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 艾米的哥哥在犯罪現場被逮了個正着。

sentences.english: The path of life again seems long, and my strength inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 人生的道路似乎又變得漫長起來，我感到力有不逮。

sentences.english: The cat sat motionless as it waited for the mouse.
sentences.chinese: 這隻貓坐着一動也不動地等着逮老鼠。

sentences.english: Little cat will catch some mice for that.
The police caught the criminal red - handed as he came out of the bank carrying a large bag of money .
sentences.chinese: 當罪犯扛着一大袋錢走出銀行時，讓警察逮了個正着。

sentences.english: If you want to eat crab by fishing, go crabbing by yourself and you will know everything.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想喫逮的螃蟹，那就自己去吧，你將明白一切。

sentences.english: The notorious robber finally got caught at a bank last week.
sentences.chinese: 這名惡名昭彰的匪賊終於在上週在一家銀行被逮了。

sentences.english: I never expected the thief to be arrested.
sentences.chinese: 我從沒有指望小偷會被逮着。

sentences.english: They were caught red-handed after being spotted by a neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 他們在作案中被鄰居逮了個正着。

sentences.english: The time for the rat-catching arrived at last, and the hunt began.
sentences.chinese: 逮老鼠的時刻終於來到了，獵鼠活動開始。

sentences.english: When Bill came home invisible she caught him.
sentences.chinese: 比爾隱形回到家裏，被太太逮了個正着。

sentences.english: Because all my friends who never got caught are not doing too well today.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我那些翹課卻沒被逮着的朋友們現在都混得不好。

definition: to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to collapse/variant of 斃|毙[bi4]/variant of 獙[bi4]
to expel/to oust/(dialect) to chase after/to try to catch up with
(of a thief, smuggler etc) to be caught with stolen or illegal goods/to be caught red-handed
to walk right into the trap
to execute on the spot (idiom); summary execution/to carry out the law on the spot
